alert.note: Alert for Middle Rio Grande Valley, Albuquerque Metro Area; West Central Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 2:39PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTH CENTRAL SANDOVAL AND BERNALILLO COUNTIES THROUGH 315 PM MDT... At 238 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Torreon, or 15 miles northwest of Rio Rancho, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Rio Rancho, Bernalillo, Northern Meadows, Enchanted Hills, Mariposa, Coronado State Monument, Rio Rancho City Center, Santa Ana Pueblo and Zia Pueblo. This includes Highway 550 between Mile Markers 2 and 9. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Motorists can expect brief but sudden changes in visibility and ponding of water on highways as storms move through the area. Accumulations of small hail on roads can create very slick and hazardous driving conditions.

area.areaDesc: Middle Rio Grande Valley, Albuquerque Metro Area; West Central Highlands
